utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've just been having this this cough over the last few days and I also notice that I'm getting like these headaches and chills as well at night. So I was just a bit concerned.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so the cough started a few days ago. Have you been bringing up any phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. It's been pretty much like a dry cough. I did feel like a tickle in my throat before it started, but no, I'm not producing any phlegm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um is the cough any worse at any particular time of day, like when you first get up or or at night when going to bed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's pretty much just been there over the last, at least like 2 days. It's been getting worse, more frequent.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so um and are you coughing all throughout the day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Pretty much, at least for the last few days. Just it's been pretty nonstop.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anything that's made the cough worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, not really. It's uh, pretty much been the same for the last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anything you've tried to make the cough go away?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just like Tylenol cold. And then I think there was another over the counter medication that I took, but nothing really helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and uh, the cough has been been getting worse. Have you been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I did just just last night, actually. I thought that I had some shortness of breath as well. I don't know if that's being caused by all the coughing, but yeah, I got pretty scared, so that's why I'm here today.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um has anything like this happened to you before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, like I've been pretty healthy otherwise completely so this is this is completely new for me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and yeah, you mentioned you had a fever but did have you checked your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't I I just had like chills over the last two nights. Just had to put on like 3 three blankets just to get to sleep, but I haven't really checked my temperature.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I have you had night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really, just mostly chills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how has your energy been the last few days, have you have you had a lot of fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I just feel completely just sick like what it feels like I have the flu or something and I just feel really tired too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had a runny nose or sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. I did have like a I don't know if it was soreness, but just like a tickle in my throat just a few days back before the coughing started.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. And have you had any loss of smell or or loss of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, now that I think of it, I I I I can't I can barely taste taste the food that I'm eating. I don't know about smell I I'm pretty stuff stuff stuffy right now so that might just be because of that. I definitely notice I can't really taste my food.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. Uh, and uh, have you been having any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and shortness of breath, were you at rest when that that happened or were you exercising or exerting yourself? What, how did the shortness of breath come on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was actually just laying down and I was sleeping and I just noticed that I couldn't really take deep breaths, so I kind of just got back up and it was just during last night. It hasn't happened after that, but I'm scared it will happen again.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you, how many pillows do you usually sleep with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you noticed any swelling in your feet or ankles?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any feeling, any episodes where you feel like you were gonna faint?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um, have you been having any abdominal pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No abdominal pains.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, how about urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any bowel problems like diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's pretty regular.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you noticed any rashes anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and then how about like muscle aches or or joint aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that, just feeling tired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and then have you had any changes to your vision?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Like blurred vision or things like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes to your voice, like it sounds more hoarse to you or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, OK, and any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did feel a bit nauseous over the last two days, but I haven't vomited.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been pretty lucky. No medical conditions. I don't even take any medications either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anything over the counter like supplements or herbal?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just just the cold medications over the counter, nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any prior surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, and could you tell me a little bit about your living situation now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, so I just live in a townhouse with my wife and two children. And yeah, currently, working as an engineer. Yeah, pretty everything else is pretty good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um have you had to miss work over the last few days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I actually didn't go to work yesterday, just felt terrible yesterday.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK how have the wife and kids been feeling at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They're actually completely fine now. They don't seem to have any any symptoms of like coughing or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anybody at work that's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: There was actually like just we work in the same kind of office setting. One of my coworkers was coughing just last week and like you know, my boss told us, told him to like, go home and get some rest and he was away for a couple days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, do you know what um what he had or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm not really sure. Now that I think of it, like I I don't I haven't seen him since. Uh, so I haven't really asked him. Yeah, I'm not really sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Has have you traveled anywhere, or has anybody in your office been been traveling anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. Not that I know, everything is pretty strict right now with with the pandemic going on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and yeah, do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just rarely, maybe a couple times a month.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you use recreational drugs like IV drug use or opioids or crystal meth, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, could you tell me a little bit about your your partner or partners?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just my wife, no other sexual partners.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and have you had a sexually transmitted infection before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so in regards to your family history, has anybody had similar symptoms before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. Not nothing like this.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any heart attacks or strokes in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then how about so any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think I've had an aunt who had breast cancer but nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, so those are all the questions I wanted to go go through on history. I am concerned that you might might have COVID-19 or coronavirus. And so it could be COVID, or this could be another viral infection or possibly pneumonia going on. But it does sound like you have an infection and so we'll check some sputum cultures. And and we'll also do a PCR nasal swab testing for COVID. So we'll go ahead and order those tests and we'll see what their their results say.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
